intro: Centropogon coccineus, commonly known as the scarlet grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright red flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Centropogon coccineus typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
